page.title: 20Local History
page.content: The first record of a Beast Market was in 1320. The growing importance of this market meant the development of associated industries and activities. The smithy, tailor, carpenter, shoemaker, the brewer, fisherman, ironmonger, etc. etc. Merchants from as far as Liverpool and Chester would attend the markets and ships from Bristol, Plymouth and Ireland would anchor in Abergele Bay. In the early 19th century 'Wells' and 'Bathing' became popular and with the advent of the railway Abergele became a tourist centre. The arrival of the first motor car was 30th May 1903 from Manchester and by 1914 there was a regular service bringing in holidaymakers from Chester, Liverpool etc. To cater for this boom the new A55 expressway has been built, by-passing Abergele.
